author: alexssd7fp
content: Things get quite bad

author: alexssd7fp
content: At that rate, we will get 88% OFAC-censored blocks if everyone starts using mev-boost

author: pietjepuk
content: OFAC compliant != censored

author: alexssd7fp
content: What does OFAC compliance mean then?

author: pietjepuk
content: there are not that many OFAC-disallowed transactions, so makes sense that most blocks do not have them

author: alexssd7fp
content: Well, that assumes that mevwatch.info tracks in that way, which is not

author: alexssd7fp
content: They track specific known builder coinbase address, and they know what builders censor blocks and what do not

author: pietjepuk
content: yes, I don't disagree with what mevwatch says it is ("OFAC compliant")

author: pietjepuk
content: _you_ said censored, which implies the existence of transactions that would otherwise have been included

author: alexssd7fp
content: So when you see a Flashbots Builder block you know that this block is censored

author: alexssd7fp
content: Right, that's a wrong word for that. But the blocks still remain "ready to censor"

author: pietjepuk
content: Cool

author: alexssd7fp
content: Was this discussed on this previous week's ACD?

author: alexssd7fp
content: Also I wonder do OFAC-compliant validators not attest to blocks that include sanctioned transactions?

author: pietjepuk
content: Afaik it's only OFAC-compliant _builders_ and _relays_ now, not validators.

author: alexssd7fp
content: Ah, true

author: potuz
content: The issue here is wether or not an OFAC banned transaction can make it on chain or not. If only flashbots builders are available they can't. However, these numbers there don't say anything: if this becomes a real problem and OFAC -censored transactions pay more gas/are susceptible to more MEV extraction, other builders will start beating flashbots. There's no indication that validators are using flashbots relayer exclusively. It may well be that their builder beats all others

author: pietjepuk
content: To add to this, so far OFAC-compliant builders/relays seem happy to build on top of, and include attestations for, OFAC-violating blocks. Not sure why one thing is NG and the other is OK, it seems rather arbitrary to me. I sorta wish the whole discussion around "we shouldn't use OFAC-compliant relays" wasn't necessary to begin with, i.e. privacy-by-default (or plausible deniability by default) on L1.

author: chris2_2_2
content: I assume the conversation will only happen once it becomes a major problem. Just like any other disaster we wait until it actually affects us.

author: potuz
content: This is not the case: we're working on prevention of this disaster both at the protocol level and at the builder API/ MEV boost

author: chris2_2_2
content: Thats awesome to hear.

author: chris2_2_2
content:
